page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO RADCLIFFE
page.content: RADCLIFFE, A SMALL INDUSTRIAL TOWN OF 30 501 PEOPLE IS PART OF THE METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF BURY IN THE COUNTY OF GREATER MANCHESTER. TRADITIONAL INDUSTRIES OF COTTON AND PAPER HAVE DECLINED IN FAVOUR OF ENGINEERING _ BUT HERE TOO THERE HAS BEEN A DECLINE WITH THE CLOSURE OF FIRMS CAUSING REDUNDANCIES AND A HIGH RATE OF UNEMPLOYMENT. THE MANCHESTER BURY BOLTON CANAL AND RIVER IRWELL HAVE BEEN SIGNIFICANT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TOWN. NEW LOW DENSITY HOUSING ESTATES, MAINLY PRIVATE, HAVE BEEN RECENTLY BUILT, FOLLOWING THE DEMOLITION OF MANY PRE FIRST WAR TERRACED HOUSING. DESPITE ITS INDUSTRIAL NATURE RADCLIFFE HAS SOME DAIRY FARMS. THE TOWN HAS A FOOTBALL CLUB IN THE NORTH WEST COUNTIES LEAGUE AND A CRICKET CLUB. THERE ARE 2 SECONDARY SCHOOLS.
